stream_context.summary: Kaze works inside Blender/Fast64 on the overworld’s volcanic section, fights export-tool and performance bugs, imports a Luigi model, and discusses recent progress such as the nearly finished Course 7 and new quality-of-life features.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 is largely finished and has been sent out for beta testing; it already runs correctly on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I finished most of course 7 and I set it out for a beta test. It fully works on real N64, which is amazing.

development_findings.summary: The ROM is currently 59.953 MB, leaving just over 4 MB before the hard 64 MB limit.
A new post-star 'Stay / Leave' dialog was implemented so players can immediately exit a course after collecting a star.
development_findings.quote: After you get a star, you can now just exit the course. In the demo you would just stay.

development_findings.summary: The overworld will eventually be rebuilt as one large level that streams in and out as the player walks; present work is a first visual pass and placeholder connectivity.
development_findings.quote: After your pass is done, I'm going to make this all into one big level that loads dynamically as you walk through it.

development_findings.summary: The island contains two volcanoes; one hosts a future theme-park area.
development_findings.quote: He has a theme park, but it's not inside this volcano. It's inside this volcano here. There's two volcanoes on the island.

development_findings.summary: Luigi’s model was imported; Kaze is exploring whether this leads to cooperative play or another mechanic.
development_findings.quote: Co-op would be the coolest option. I'm not 100 % sure exactly how Luigi ties into this yet.

development_findings.summary: ‘Side levels’ are planned as small, faster-to-build areas (about 1–2 days each) featuring five bosses, e.g. a stealth oil-tanker that links to Oily Body Bay.
development_findings.quote: These side levels ... are going to be small levels. We're probably going to make each one of them in like a day or two at most.

development_findings.summary: The engine has been rewritten multiple times, multiplying the bug-fix workload but improving performance.
development_findings.quote: Bug fixing is a lot of work ... especially because we rewrote the engine so many times.

development_findings.summary: Upgrading to Blender 4.1 caused severe lag; switching to the new F64 Renderer add-on dropped CPU load to near zero and restored usability.
development_findings.quote: Wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats … this is kind of goated.

development_findings.summary: Fast64’s 'write all' option silently toggles itself back on, corrupting exports (e.g., removing Mario’s hair). Removing the line from repo settings fixed the issue.
development_findings.quote: This option turns itself on whenever you open the file. No wonder I kept getting bugs.

development_findings.summary: Transparent decals and depth quantisation behave incorrectly in the F64 renderer, indicating new rendering bugs that need attention.
PAL support is currently an afterthought and will be tackled only after NTSC development is stable.
development_findings.quote: For me PAL right now is in the background. That will have to be an afterthought.

development_findings.summary: Targeting perfect FPS on real hardware remains a core goal; Wiseguy’s tools and the upcoming Analogue 3D are expected to work with the hack.
development_findings.quote: We're targeting real hardware. Basically perfect FPS.

context_findings.summary: Kaze estimates he could earn USD 60–70 k annually via YouTube videos but prefers streaming even though it is less profitable.
context_findings.quote: If I just made YouTube videos, I think I could pretty easily get like … maybe like 60,000–70,000 a year. … But I don't want to.

context_findings.summary: He is open to a sponsor for the next F3 showcase to fund editing costs.
context_findings.quote: How much would you guys hate the idea of F3 this year having a YouTube sponsor? That's like the easiest way I can justify making another F3.

context_findings.summary: Kaze will be off his day job for two weeks soon and plans daily streams to finish the overworld during that window.
context_findings.quote: In two weeks, I'll be off work. So there might be like a full two weeks of streams. We will probably finish the overworld in those two weeks.

context_findings.summary: Frustration surfaces repeatedly (write-all bug, Blender lag) but also visible relief when solutions emerge.
Kaze jokes that if he lost his job the game might be finished by year-end, hinting at time constraints from employment.
context_findings.quote: The game has a good chance of being done by the end of the year. Maybe like if I lose my job.

context_findings.summary: Philosophical tangents reveal skepticism about current economic systems and a preference for practical, incentive-based design.

biobak.summary: Suggested that he might also adopt the F64 renderer to improve workflow efficiency.
biobak.quote: Damn, Biobak, maybe you should download this renderer too.

zeina.summary: Dropped into chat while Kaze was UV-mapping, indicating ongoing involvement but no specific task discussed.

key_stories.title: Write All Strips Mario’s Hair
key_stories.summary: Mario’s hair disappeared after export. Investigation showed Fast64’s 'write all' flag re-enables itself on file load, conflicting with bleed settings.
key_stories.challenge: Repeated model corruption linked to missing hair.
key_stories.process: Tested exports with and without 'write all', located auto-set flag in repo JSON, removed it.
key_stories.outcome: Hair renders correctly; awareness of a broader Fast64 settings bug.
key_stories.key_quote: This option turns itself on whenever you open the file. No wonder I kept getting bugs.

key_stories.title: Blender 4.1 Meltdown and the F64 Renderer Fix
key_stories.summary: Upgrading Blender caused crippling lag. Installing and switching to the F64 renderer immediately restored smooth performance.
key_stories.challenge: Extreme slowdown made level editing impractical.
key_stories.process: Monitored CPU usage, restarted Blender, installed add-on, changed render settings.
key_stories.outcome: Workflow rescued and tool chain recommendation for team.
key_stories.key_quote: Wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats—this is kind of goated.

key_stories.title: Exit-Course Quality-of-Life Upgrade
key_stories.summary: Kaze added a prompt allowing players to leave a course immediately after collecting a star, fixing pacing issues from the demo.
key_stories.challenge: Players were forced to remain in levels post-star.
key_stories.process: Implemented new dialog and tested in-game.
key_stories.outcome: Improved user flow; feature now part of core experience.
key_stories.key_quote: After you get a star, you can now just exit the course. … That's a bit awkward, I think.
